intro: Bocoa marioniae, commonly known as the Marion's bocoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
